economic_context.details: Fleuratte and her husband were in great want when she was seduced (7 years before trial). Multiple witnesses reported envy over earnings - accused was envious that neighbors earned more than her husband. Catherine and Claudon Mathieu both owed money to their brother-in-law, which led to quarrel. Dispute over 'apparois' (property boundary) with Jacquat Frouart. Multiple witnesses reported loss of property and reduction to poverty after quarrels with Fleuratte. Sabbat confession reveals social stratification: rich and poor sat at separate tables with poor receiving less respect.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost all his property without knowing how, reduced to 'disette et pauvreté' (want and poverty)
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Disputes over an 'apparois' between their houses

harms_catalog.harm_description: Three times attacked by mysterious assailant on way back from Baccarat, who disappeared when he cried 'Jesus Maria'
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs

harms_catalog.harm_description: Accident sawing timber in woods; piece slipped and injured his leg, still suffering great pain
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She had been asking his wife and son daily where he was, from envy that he worked and earned more than her husband

harms_catalog.victim_name: Daughter of Claudatte wife of Diez Lessemat
harms_catalog.harm_description: Year-old daughter seized by fever which lasted 18 months; made temporary recovery after accused advised rubbing with water, but died after another 3 months
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: 7 francs sent to witness delivered in error to Fleuratte; Fleuratte angry when asked to return them

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He had killed a hen belonging to Fleuratte which had been damaging barley he had sown near her house; she was angry and told him it would cost him more than at the market

harms_catalog.victim_name: Son of Catherine wife of Claudon Mathieu
harms_catalog.harm_description: Son aged about 2 became ill after he beat Fleuratte's child; recovered after about a fortnight, then became ill again for 6 months
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Son had beaten Fleuratte's child; Fleuratte envious of her husband

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost her milk for 7 weeks after delivery; Fleuratte had visited after delivery and put something under bedhead; milk returned day after witness threatened to send husband to devin
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over debt to brother-in-law; witness said they were not so well off; Fleuratte was angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost their money and property, being reduced to poverty
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness's daughter Odille told Fleuratte that if her grandmother had lived she would not have married present husband; Fleuratte had borne them ill-will since

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost their property and become very poor
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Opposition to Fleuratte's marriage to Georgeatte's brother; their mother had opposed marriage on grounds of ill repute; Fleuratte bore them 'une hayne forte couverte' (a strong concealed hatred)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Son aged 2 became ill; advised to rub him with brandy and rosewater; immediately became better though still having leg trouble
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: After waking in night and finding room full of cats

harms_catalog.victim_name: Dog belonging to Bastienne wife of Demenge Daulphin
harms_catalog.harm_description: Dog became ill and died as Fleuratte was rubbing vinegar on its muzzle
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over dogs belonging to witness and accused which were suckling one another's pups; after witness sold one of hers the other became ill

harms_catalog.harm_description: Seized by leg trouble; leg so swollen went to surgeon but unable to obtain cure; went on crutches and had to beg for support; generally agreed sickness was not natural but witchcraft
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She was always asking what he was doing, jealous that he earned more than her husband

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She 's'informait sous main' (secretly inquired) and said by 'une envie determinée' (a determined envy) that his wife was better off than her

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fine pig became ill next day and died as if rabid
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrelled over pig which Fleuratte had been beating when it went to her house

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: They had refused one of Fleuratte's children milk, although they had plenty

harms_catalog.harm_description: Caused her to lose her milk
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boeufs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Heard someone say 'la diable la puisse emporter' as she entered
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Later felt sorry and obtained healing powder from master (from confession)

Jacquat Frouart was returning from Baccarat when attacked by mysterious assailant three times

rich did not want to have to aid poor (from sabbat confession)

hearsay_chains.source: heard Fleuratte ask her neighbour Georgeatte
hearsay_chains.content: Story about small black dog among the pigs

emotional_state_notes: long silences before she replied during first interrogation
said master had prevented her from speaking earlier but had just left her on account of her fear of the prison
said she saw she must die in view of great charges against her

third_parties.name: Didier Malley
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: husband of woman who accused Fleuratte
third_parties.context: Husband of Georgeatte who accused Fleuratte and was executed May 6, 1615

third_parties.name: Georgeatte wife of Didier Malley
third_parties.context: Executed on May 6, 1615; maintained accusation against Fleuratte until death; Fleuratte saw her at sabbat; judges said she was 'bien heureuse devant Dieu' because she persisted so constantly in her confessions

third_parties.name: Mengin des Boeufs
third_parties.context: His wife and Georgeatte found accused having a fit some 5 years earlier

third_parties.name: Wife of Mengin des Boeufs
third_parties.context: She and Georgeatte found accused having a fit some 5 years earlier, vomiting and unable to speak - believed her master might have been beating her

third_parties.name: Odille
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: daughter of Nicolle wife of Jean des Boeufs
third_parties.context: Told Fleuratte that if her grandmother had lived she would not have married present husband; caused quarrel 8 years before

third_parties.name: Grandmother of Bastien des Boeufs
third_parties.context: Reference to her in Odille's insult to Fleuratte

third_parties.name: Mother of Bastien des Boeufs and Georgeatte
third_parties.context: Had always opposed Fleuratte's marriage on grounds of ill repute; died about 10 years before trial (before marriage)

third_parties.name: Sebille daughter of Didier Pescheur
third_parties.context: Seen at sabbat; had later fled when enquiries began about her

third_parties.name: Jean Gelliat
third_parties.context: Fleuratte's uncle; seen at sabbat; she would maintain accusation if confronted with him

third_parties.name: Claudon wife of Curien Dautant
third_parties.context: Died previous year; Curien believed Fleuratte caused her death out of envy

third_parties.name: Children of Fleuratte
third_parties.context: Mentioned in testimony - one child beaten by Catherine's son; Fleuratte refused to kill husband because it would leave her and children in poverty; one child was refused milk by Claudon Mathieu

third_parties.name: Son of Jean des Boeufs
third_parties.context: Fleuratte had been asking him daily where his father was

third_parties.name: Wife of Jean des Boeufs (witness 2)
third_parties.context: Fleuratte had been asking her daily where her husband was

third_parties.name: Brother-in-law of Catherine and Claudon Mathieu
third_parties.context: Both Catherine and Claudon's husbands owed money to him; source of debt dispute

third_parties.name: Devin (diviner)
third_parties.context: Catherine threatened to send her husband to a devin to find out the truth about her lost milk

third_parties.name: Surgeon
third_parties.context: Curien Dautant went to surgeon for his swollen leg but unable to obtain cure

third_parties.name: Mre Navel
third_parties.context: Name of devil/master who seduced Fleuratte 7 years before when husband was ill and they were in great want

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial has clear documentation with 11 witnesses and detailed confession. Key uncertainties: (1) The exact relationship between Jean des Boeufs (witness 2) and Fleuratte is unclear - same surname suggests possible family relation but not stated. (2) The term 'apparois' appears to be a property boundary or passage between houses but exact meaning uncertain. (3) Witness 10 (Magdelaine) provided no specific harms but confirmed reputation and told of incident where Fleuratte seemed to have fit 5 years earlier. (4) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: being in great want at time of seduction, envy over others' earnings, husband earning less than neighbors, sitting at table with poor at sabbat, devil's comment about not wanting to kill husband because it would leave family in poverty. (5) Practiced_healing set to true based on: advised Catherine to rub child with water, advised Georgeatte to rub son with brandy and rosewater, obtained healing powder from master, knew Catherine's milk had returned without being told - suggests cunning knowledge. (6) No torture used - confession was voluntary after initial denial. (7) Timeline shows very rapid trial: Nov 3 informations, Nov 9 interrogation with denial, Nov 10 voluntary confession, Nov 16 approval, Nov 17 execution - only 14 days total. (8) Sabbat confession reveals interesting class dynamics: rich and poor sat at separate tables with different levels of respect; comment about rich not wanting to aid poor in context of hailstorm. (9) Devil's name 'Mre Navel' is unusual. (10) Confession mentions devil wanted her to kill her husband 'a cause qu'il luy estoit rude' (because he was rough/harsh with her) but she refused fearing poverty.
